messages.subject: Re: [nihonto] Chicago chit-chat anyone?
messages.msgSnippet: Ron, As soon as it s out send me a bill. Don t want my book collection having a gap. Best, Andres ... -- Sent from my mobile device
messages.messageBody:
Ron,

As soon as it's out send me a bill. Don't want my book collection having a gap.

Best,

Andres

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: [nihonto] Chicago chit-chat anyone?
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks guys. For those unfamiliar with our annual KTK (Kokusai Tosogu Kai) publication, these are high quality printed hard-cover (with slip cover) books
messages.messageBody:
Thanks guys. For those unfamiliar with our annual KTK (Kokusai Tosogu Kai) publication, these are high quality printed hard-cover (with slip cover) books showing photographs with descriptions of high quality fittings (the best) selected from members' collections. The KTK is a small private international club of tosogu collectors. Members fund these publications as as a means of supporting our organization (there are no dues) while sharing knowledge of fine tosogu. Each member is expected to buy (10) copies of these limited printings (usually 400 copies) while others will buy twenty or thirty copies and resell them. Myself, I've been charging $90 pp to U.S. addresses which is, considering the cost of the photography and final printing, plus shipping. Some members do not even try to break even; myself, I prefer to not particularly take a loss, but that's just me. Anyway, that's a little background on these KTK publications. The 2010 edition is already being worked on and will be bigger and better than before, from preliminary indications. Feel free to contact me privately at: swords@... if interested in buying a copy. Those outside of the U.S.A. can buy them cheaper (because of shipping costs) from local members.

Ron
STL

----- Original Message -----
From: Andres Pedraza
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, May 03, 2010 7:33 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: [nihonto] Chicago chit-chat anyone?



I'll plug his KTK books, they're worth every penny.

Best,

Andres

On 5/3/10, excelsiorilluminati <excelsiorilluminati@...> wrote:
> Hi Ron, That's too bad. Still fallout from the real estate bubble I suppose.
> In Canada now, back to start a new season onboard my ship in a week. Thanks
> for having a look-see. I am trying to match a koshirae for my Nosada. It is
> here, http://www.johnstuart.biz/new_page_14.htm to show what I am going
> for. Of course if anyone else reading this knows of one for sale that would
> be suitable, please rattle my cage. Ron, I completely forgot about the KTK
> book and will remedy that soon, after all I have all the others and they
> always have had something to tickle my fancy. Regards, John
>
> --- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Ron Hartmann" <swords@...> wrote:
>>
>> Hi John -

>> Just home from Chicago show and catching up with things here. Fun socially
>> for me, but sold next to nothing therefore, but next to nothing.
>>
>> Will check the kogai for you but I do not think there is anything in
>> Mino-bori. Did you ever get my response to you on the 2009 KTK book? Never
>> heard back from you on that. Are you back in Japan? If so, lucky you!!
>>
>> Ron
>> STL

>> To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
>> Sent: Monday, May 03, 2010 8:37 AM
>> Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: Chicago chit-chat anyone?
>>

>> a plethora of kogai and would perhaps be pruning your collection. Do you
>> by any chance have a Mino-bori kogai that is cluttering up the drawer?
>> Anyone else? Of good good to very good quality. It is true that once this
>> site and others had a lot of traffic. Learned a lot over time here. John
>> Stuart
>>

>> >

>> > But no fear, the NMB still visits here daily too :-)

messages.subject: Re: Chicago chit-chat anyone?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Ron, That s too bad. Still fallout from the real estate bubble I suppose. In Canada now, back to start a new season onboard my ship in a week. Thanks for
messages.messageBody:
Hi Ron, That's too bad. Still fallout from the real estate bubble I suppose. In Canada now, back to start a new season onboard my ship in a week. Thanks for having a look-see. I am trying to match a koshirae for my Nosada. It is here, http://www.johnstuart.biz/new_page_14.htm to show what I am going for. Of course if anyone else reading this knows of one for sale that would be suitable, please rattle my cage. Ron, I completely forgot about the KTK book and will remedy that soon, after all I have all the others and they always have had something to tickle my fancy. Regards, John

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Chicago chit-chat anyone?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi John - Just home from Chicago show and catching up with things here. Fun socially for me, but sold next to nothing therefore, but next to nothing. Will
messages.messageBody:
Hi John -

Just home from Chicago show and catching up with things here. Fun socially for me, but sold next to nothing therefore, but next to nothing.

Will check the kogai for you but I do not think there is anything in Mino-bori. Did you ever get my response to you on the 2009 KTK book? Never heard back from you on that. Are you back in Japan? If so, lucky you!!

Ron
STL

----- Original Message -----
From: excelsiorilluminati
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, May 03, 2010 8:37 AM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: Chicago chit-chat anyone?



Hi Ron, I remember a couple of years ago in Japan you mentioned you had a plethora of kogai and would perhaps be pruning your collection. Do you by any chance have a Mino-bori kogai that is cluttering up the drawer? Anyone else? Of good good to very good quality. It is true that once this site and others had a lot of traffic. Learned a lot over time here. John Stuart

--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "sigp210" <sigp210@...> wrote:
>
> Thanks Mike,
> But no fear, the NMB still visits here daily too :-)
> I think the convenience of easy picture uploading makes forums attractive for newer enthusiasts, but the old school still prefers the ease of email chats I think.
>
> This is more personal possibly than my NMB.
>
> Brian
>
>
> --- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, Michael Vinehout <mljvine@> wrote:
> >
> >

> >

messages.subject: Re: Chicago chit-chat anyone?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Ron, I remember a couple of years ago in Japan you mentioned you had a plethora of kogai and would perhaps be pruning your collection. Do you by any chance
messages.messageBody:
Hi Ron, I remember a couple of years ago in Japan you mentioned you had a plethora of kogai and would perhaps be pruning your collection. Do you by any chance have a Mino-bori kogai that is cluttering up the drawer? Anyone else? Of good good to very good quality. It is true that once this site and others had a lot of traffic. Learned a lot over time here. John Stuart

messages.msgSnippet: Thanks Mike, But no fear, the NMB still visits here daily too :-) I think the convenience of easy picture uploading makes forums attractive for newer
messages.messageBody:
Thanks Mike,
But no fear, the NMB still visits here daily too :-)
I think the convenience of easy picture uploading makes forums attractive for newer enthusiasts, but the old school still prefers the ease of email chats I think.

This is more personal possibly than my NMB.

Brian

On 28/04/2010 6:50 AM, Ron Hartmann wrote:

> Hi all -

> Gosh, so little traffic on the various "lists" of late, is anybody

> still interested in swords and tosogu these days? The Chicago show if

> upon us this coming weekend. Anybody bringing anything particularly

> exciting for sale or just show-and-tell? ?? I do know the

> NBTHK-American branch will have an exciting Horikawa school display

> for our fondling pleasure. My contribution will be a large and

> exciting naginata by Horikawa Kunimichi with horimono. Bob Benson has

> been busy rounding up a number of great examples of the school's

> works, so it should be both an educational and visually pleasing display.

>

> I'm not sure just yet what I'll bring for sharing. That depends on my

> level of energy, but most likely I'll have a couple of Juyo daito

> along and maybe a recently polished gendai naginata, a rarity. So stop

> by and say hello and don't be bashful about asking to see these

> beautiful treasures! They're what it's all about! Nothing very "fresh"

> for my table, but nice things irregardless, and all "open for offers"

> if at all possible. I'll have our latest KTK 2009 publication

> available and maybe a number of excellent (an somewhat pricey) tosogu

> and sword related books, too.

>

> Any signed/dated Jirotaro swords or tsuba coming??? Remember me.

>

> Ron

> STL

>

messages.subject: Chicago chit-chat anyone?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all - Gosh, so little traffic on the various lists of late, is anybody still interested in swords and tosogu these days? The Chicago show if upon us this
messages.messageBody:
Hi all -

Gosh, so little traffic on the various "lists" of late, is anybody still interested in swords and tosogu these days? The Chicago show if upon us this coming weekend. Anybody bringing anything particularly exciting for sale or just show-and-tell??? I do know the NBTHK-American branch will have an exciting Horikawa school display for our fondling pleasure. My contribution will be a large and exciting naginata by Horikawa Kunimichi with horimono. Bob Benson has been busy rounding up a number of great examples of the school's works, so it should be both an educational and visually pleasing display.

I'm not sure just yet what I'll bring for sharing. That depends on my level of energy, but most likely I'll have a couple of Juyo daito along and maybe a recently polished gendai naginata, a rarity. So stop by and say hello and don't be bashful about asking to see these beautiful treasures! They're what it's all about! Nothing very "fresh" for my table, but nice things irregardless, and all "open for offers" if at all possible. I'll have our latest KTK 2009 publication available and maybe a number of excellent (an somewhat pricey) tosogu and sword related books, too.

Any signed/dated Jirotaro swords or tsuba coming??? Remember me.

Ron
STL

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
